meanings.sent1: I will pass the ball to you.
meanings.sent2: The cars pass by quickly on the highway.
meanings.sent3: I tried to pass the salt, but it slipped from my hand!
meanings.sent4: Time seems to pass like a river flowing endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The clouds pass overhead, casting shadows on the ground.

meanings.sent1: The train will pass through the tunnel.
meanings.sent2: I pass the park on my way to work every day.
meanings.sent3: I tried to pass the finish line first, but you beat me!
meanings.sent4: The years pass by like pages turning in a book.
meanings.sent5: The sun will pass behind the mountains soon, ending the day.

meanings.definition: Succeed in an examination or test.
meanings.sent1: I hope to pass my math test tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She studied hard to pass the driving exam.
meanings.sent3: I tried to pass the quiz by guessing all the answers!
meanings.sent4: If you study diligently, you will pass with flying colors.
meanings.sent5: Passing the test felt like a weight lifted off my shoulders.

meanings.definition: A document granting permission to do something.
meanings.sent1: Please show your pass to enter the building.
meanings.sent2: The security guard checked my pass before letting me in.
meanings.sent3: I lost my pass, so I had to wait outside.
meanings.sent4: The golden pass allowed access to all areas of the theme park.
meanings.sent5: Having a pass makes it easier to move around the restricted area.
